page.title: 14LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {MOONZIE CHURCH}WAS MENTIONED IN A CHARTER DATED{1202.}IT WAS REDEDICATED BY {DAVID DE BERNHAM}IN{1245.}MARINERS USED TO USE IT AS A NAVIGATIONAL POINT BECAUSE IT WAS SO HIGH SO THE EAST FACING WALL WAS KEPT CONSTANTLY WHITE WASHED.THE ROOF WAS MADE OF BURNISHED COPPER.{CREICH CHURCH }WAS BUILT IN { {1832 }AS A REPLACEMENT FOR THE OLD {CHURCH,}OUTSIDE OUR AREA.{LUTHRIE HALL WAS BUILT BY A{LOCAL FAMILY.}THERE IS A COMMITTEE MADE UP OF DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES' MEMBERS.{LUTHRIE PARK} WAS ALSO GIFTED BY A{LOCAL FAMILY.}IT IS{15}YEARS OLD AND THE COMMUNITY HELPED PAY FOR THE SWINGS. AT PARBROATH THERE ARE THE REMAINS OF A CASTLE AND ITS DOVECOTE. LORDSCAIRNIE CASTLE AT{MOONZIE}IS ABOUT 600 YEARS OLD.
